application

Class Features

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Features

  • public class Features
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the functionality of the application handling character strings in different ways.
    Author:
    Marcos Esteban Vargas Avella.

        public int searchTimeWord(java.lang.String word)
        This method looks for the times that a string is skipped in another string
        Parameters:
        word - The word parameter defines the string to search for in the string entered as the class constructor parameter
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • addCharacters

        public java.lang.String addCharacters(char letter,
                                      int amount,
                                      java.lang.String orientation)
        Method that seeks to generate a string concatenated with the character n times left or right
        Parameters:
        letter - The letter parameter defines the character to be added to the parameter string of the class constructor
        amount - The amount parameter defines the number of times the letter character will be repeated
        orientation - The orientation parameter defines if the data will be entered from the left or to the right of the class constructor parameter string
        Returns:
        The string with the character "letter" repeated "amount" times on the "orientation" side

      • deleteCharacter

        public java.lang.String deleteCharacter(char letter)
        This method removes the letter character from the entire string set by default in the class constructor
        Parameters:
        letter - The letter parameter defines the character to be removed from the parameter string from the class constructor
        Returns:
        The string without the letter character anywhere

      • intersectStrings

        public java.lang.String intersectStrings(java.lang.String word)
        Method that searches for the string with the intersection of characters between two strings (word and defaultMessaje), without repeating.
        Parameters:
        word - The word parameter defines a string that will be matched with the constructor's parameter string
        Returns:
        String with the characters found both in the string "word" of the method parameter and in the class constructor parameter string

      • differentiateStrings

        public java.lang.String differentiateStrings(java.lang.String word)
        This method faces two strings in order to show at the end which characters do not belong to the intersection of themselves
        Parameters:
        word - The word parameter defines a string that will be matched to the parent string of the constructor of class
        Returns:
        A string with all the characters that do not have "word" or defaultMessage in common.

      • deleteCharactersWithWord

        public java.lang.String deleteCharactersWithWord(java.lang.String word,
                                                 java.lang.String orientation)
        This Method seeks to Delete to the Left or Right of the string the characters that exist in the input string, until you find a character that does not exist in the input string
        Parameters:
        word - The word parameter defines the string that will be matched to default Message
        orientation - The orientation parameter defines if the tour will start from the left or right
        Returns:
        String without the characters found from the word string.

      • validateEmail

        public boolean validateEmail(java.lang.String email)
        This method seeks to validate email addresses based on the RFC 3696 Standard
        Parameters:
        email - The email parameter defines the string of an email address to validate
        Returns:
        Logical value, which indicates whether the incoming email address is valid or not.
